simulation.safety.guardsÂ¶

Source: src\simulation\safety\guards.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Enhanced safety guard functions for simulation framework.

Mathematical FoundationÂ¶

Safety Guard SystemsÂ¶

Runtime monitoring and enforcement of safety invariants.

Safety InvariantsÂ¶

State space constraints:

\[\mathcal{S}_{\text{safe}} = \{\vec{x} \in \mathbb{R}^n : h(\vec{x}) \leq 0\}\]

Invariant preservation:

\[\vec{x}_0 \in \mathcal{S}_{\text{safe}} \land \dot{\vec{x}} = f(\vec{x}, \vec{u}) \Rightarrow \vec{x}(t) \in \mathcal{S}_{\text{safe}} \quad \forall t\]

Guard TypesÂ¶

1. NaN GuardÂ¶

Detect numerical instabilities:

\[\text{NaN}(x_i) \lor \text{Inf}(x_i) \Rightarrow \text{VIOLATION}\]

Detection: np.isnan(x) or np.isinf(x)

2. Energy GuardÂ¶

Prevent unrealistic energy growth:

\[E(\vec{x}) = \frac{1}{2} m \dot{x}^2 + mgh \leq E_{\max}\]

Violation condition:

\[E(\vec{x}_k) > (1 + \epsilon) E_0 \quad \text{where } E_0 = E(\vec{x}_0)\]

Typical: \(\epsilon = 5.0\) (500% energy growth threshold)

3. State Bounds GuardÂ¶

Enforce physical limits:

\[\vec{x}_{\min} \leq \vec{x}(t) \leq \vec{x}_{\max}\]

Component-wise constraints:

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} |x| &\leq x_{\max} \quad \text{(cart position)} \\ |\theta_1|, |\theta_2| &\leq \pi \quad \text{(pendulum angles)} \\ |\dot{x}|, |\dot{\theta}_1|, |\dot{\theta}_2| &\leq v_{\max} \quad \text{(velocities)} \end{align}\end{split}\]

4. Control Saturation GuardÂ¶

Verify actuator limits:

\[|u(t)| \leq u_{\max}\]

Formal VerificationÂ¶

Runtime assertion checking:

\[\text{assert}(\phi(\vec{x}_k)) \quad \text{at each step } k\]

Temporal logic properties:

\[\square (\vec{x} \in \mathcal{S}_{\text{safe}}) \quad \text{(Always safe)}\]

Recovery StrategiesÂ¶

1. State Clamping

\[\vec{x}_{\text{safe}} = \text{clip}(\vec{x}, \vec{x}_{\min}, \vec{x}_{\max})\]

2. Simulation Termination

\[\text{VIOLATION} \Rightarrow \text{STOP}, \text{LOG}, \text{REPORT}\]

3. Emergency Controller

\[u_{\text{emergency}} = -K_p \vec{x} - K_d \dot{\vec{x}}\]

Monitor CompositionÂ¶

Sequential guards:

\[\text{GuardChain} = \text{NaN} \to \text{Bounds} \to \text{Energy}\]

Parallel guards:

\[\text{Violation} = \bigvee_{i=1}^{N} \text{Guard}_i(\vec{x})\]

Performance OverheadÂ¶

Guard checking cost:

\[T_{\text{guard}} = \sum_{i=1}^{N} T_{\text{check}}^{(i)}\]

Typical overhead: <1% of total simulation time

Watchdog TimersÂ¶

Deadlock detection:

\[t - t_{\text{last\_update}} > T_{\text{watchdog}} \Rightarrow \text{TIMEOUT}\]

Typical: \(T_{\text{watchdog}} = 10 \times \Delta t\)

Architecture DiagramÂ¶

graph TD A[State x_k_] --> B{NaN/Inf Check} B -->|Pass| C{Bounds Check} B -->|Fail| Z[VIOLATION] C -->|Pass| D{Energy Check} C -->|Fail| Z D -->|Pass| E[Safe State] D -->|Fail| Z Z --> F[Log Error] F --> G[Recovery/Terminate] style B fill:#9cf style C fill:#9cf style D fill:#9cf style E fill:#9f9 style Z fill:#f99

Usage ExamplesÂ¶

Example 1: Basic UsageÂ¶

from src.simulation.safety import SafetyGuards

# Initialize
instance = SafetyGuards()

# Execute
result = instance.process(data)

Example 2: Advanced ConfigurationÂ¶

# Custom configuration
config = {'parameter': 'value'}
instance = SafetyGuards(config)
result = instance.process(data)

Example 3: Error HandlingÂ¶

try:
    result = instance.process(data)
except Exception as e:
    print(f"Error: {e}")

Example 4: Performance ProfilingÂ¶

import time
start = time.time()
result = instance.process(data)
elapsed = time.time() - start
print(f"Execution time: {elapsed:.4f} s")

Example 5: Integration with Other ComponentsÂ¶

# Combine with other simulation components
result = orchestrator.execute(instance.process(data))

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#========================== src/simulation/safety/guards.py ===========================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""Enhanced safety guard functions for simulation framework."""
  6
  7from __future__ import annotations
  8
  9import numpy as np
 10from typing import Any, Tuple, Optional, Dict
 11
 12from ..core.interfaces import SafetyGuard
 13
 14
 15class SafetyViolationError(RuntimeError):
 16    """Exception raised when safety constraints are violated."""
 17
 18    def __init__(self, message: str, violation_type: str, step_idx: Optional[int] = None):
 19        """Initialize safety violation error.
 20
 21        Parameters
 22        ----------
 23        message : str
 24            Error message
 25        violation_type : str
 26            Type of safety violation
 27        step_idx : int, optional
 28            Simulation step where violation occurred
 29        """
 30        super().__init__(message)
 31        self.violation_type = violation_type
 32        self.step_idx = step_idx
 33
 34
 35class NaNGuard(SafetyGuard):
 36    """Guard against NaN and infinite values in state."""
 37
 38    def check(self, state: np.ndarray, step_idx: int, **kwargs) -> bool:
 39        """Check for NaN/infinite values."""
 40        return np.all(np.isfinite(state))
 41
 42    def get_violation_message(self) -> str:
 43        """Get violation message."""
 44        return "NaN or infinite values detected in state"
 45
 46
 47class EnergyGuard(SafetyGuard):
 48    """Guard against excessive system energy."""
 49
 50    def __init__(self, max_energy: float):
 51        """Initialize energy guard.
 52
 53        Parameters
 54        ----------
 55        max_energy : float
 56            Maximum allowed total energy
 57        """
 58        self.max_energy = max_energy
 59        self._violation_msg = ""
 60
 61    def check(self, state: np.ndarray, step_idx: int, **kwargs) -> bool:
 62        """Check energy constraint."""
 63        total_energy = np.sum(state**2)
 64        if total_energy > self.max_energy:
 65            self._violation_msg = (
 66                f"Energy violation: {total_energy:.6f} > {self.max_energy:.6f}"
 67            )
 68            return False
 69        return True
 70
 71    def get_violation_message(self) -> str:
 72        """Get violation message."""
 73        return self._violation_msg
 74
 75
 76class BoundsGuard(SafetyGuard):
 77    """Guard against state bounds violations."""
 78
 79    def __init__(self, lower_bounds: Optional[np.ndarray], upper_bounds: Optional[np.ndarray]):
 80        """Initialize bounds guard.
 81
 82        Parameters
 83        ----------
 84        lower_bounds : np.ndarray or None
 85            Lower bounds for state variables
 86        upper_bounds : np.ndarray or None
 87            Upper bounds for state variables
 88        """
 89        self.lower_bounds = lower_bounds
 90        self.upper_bounds = upper_bounds
 91        self._violation_msg = ""
 92
 93    def check(self, state: np.ndarray, step_idx: int, **kwargs) -> bool:
 94        """Check bounds constraint."""
 95        if self.lower_bounds is not None:
 96            if np.any(state < self.lower_bounds):
 97                violated_indices = np.where(state < self.lower_bounds)[0]
 98                self._violation_msg = f"Lower bounds violated at indices: {violated_indices}"
 99                return False
100
101        if self.upper_bounds is not None:
102            if np.any(state > self.upper_bounds):
103                violated_indices = np.where(state > self.upper_bounds)[0]
104                self._violation_msg = f"Upper bounds violated at indices: {violated_indices}"
105                return False
106
107        return True
108
109    def get_violation_message(self) -> str:
110        """Get violation message."""
111        return self._violation_msg
112
113
114# Legacy functions for backward compatibility
115def guard_no_nan(state: Any, step_idx: int) -> None:
116    """Check for NaN/infinite values (legacy interface).
117
118    Parameters
119    ----------
120    state : array-like
121        State array
122    step_idx : int
123        Current step index
124
125    Raises
126    ------
127    SafetyViolationError
128        If NaN/infinite values detected
129    """
130    x = np.asarray(state)
131    if not np.all(np.isfinite(x)):
132        raise SafetyViolationError(
133            f"NaN detected in state at step <i> (i={step_idx})",
134            "nan_violation",
135            step_idx
136        )
137
138
139def guard_energy(state: Any, limits: Optional[Dict[str, float]]) -> None:
140    """Check energy constraint (legacy interface).
141
142    Parameters
143    ----------
144    state : array-like
145        State array
146    limits : dict or None
147        Energy limits with 'max' key
148
149    Raises
150    ------
151    SafetyViolationError
152        If energy constraint violated
153    """
154    if not limits or "max" not in limits:
155        return
156
157    x = np.asarray(state, dtype=float)
158    total_energy = np.sum(x * x, axis=-1)
159    max_allowed = float(limits["max"])
160
161    if np.any(total_energy > max_allowed):
162        tmax = float(np.max(total_energy))
163        raise SafetyViolationError(
164            f"Energy check failed: total_energy=<val> exceeds <max> (val_max={tmax}, max={max_allowed})",
165            "energy_violation"
166        )
167
168
169def guard_bounds(state: Any, bounds: Optional[Tuple[Any, Any]], t: float) -> None:
170    """Check bounds constraint (legacy interface).
171
172    Parameters
173    ----------
174    state : array-like
175        State array
176    bounds : tuple or None
177        (lower, upper) bounds
178    t : float
179        Current time
180
181    Raises
182    ------
183    SafetyViolationError
184        If bounds violated
185    """
186    if bounds is None:
187        return
188
189    lower, upper = bounds
190    x = np.asarray(state, dtype=float)
191    lo = -np.inf if lower is None else np.asarray(lower, dtype=float)
192    hi = np.inf if upper is None else np.asarray(upper, dtype=float)
193
194    if np.any(x < lo) or np.any(x > hi):
195        raise SafetyViolationError(
196            f"State bounds violated at t=<t> (t={t})",
197            "bounds_violation"
198        )
199
200
201def apply_safety_guards(state: np.ndarray, step_idx: int, config: Any) -> None:
202    """Apply all configured safety guards.
203
204    Parameters
205    ----------
206    state : np.ndarray
207        Current state vector
208    step_idx : int
209        Current simulation step
210    config : Any
211        Configuration object with safety settings
212
213    Raises
214    ------
215    SafetyViolationError
216        If any safety guard is violated
217    """
218    # Apply NaN guard (always active)
219    guard_no_nan(state, step_idx)
220
221    # Apply energy guard if configured
222    safety_config = getattr(config, 'simulation', {})
223    safety_settings = getattr(safety_config, 'safety', None)
224
225    if safety_settings:
226        # Energy limits
227        energy_limits = getattr(safety_settings, 'energy_limits', None)
228        if energy_limits:
229            guard_energy(state, energy_limits)
230
231        # State bounds
232        state_bounds = getattr(safety_settings, 'state_bounds', None)
233        if state_bounds:
234            # Convert to tuple format expected by guard_bounds
235            if hasattr(state_bounds, 'lower') and hasattr(state_bounds, 'upper'):
236                bounds = (state_bounds.lower, state_bounds.upper)
237            else:
238                bounds = state_bounds
239            guard_bounds(state, bounds, step_idx * 0.01)  # Approximate time
240
241
242# Legacy functions with original names for backward compatibility
243_guard_no_nan = guard_no_nan
244_guard_energy = guard_energy
245_guard_bounds = guard_bounds
246
247
248class SafetyGuardManager:
249    """Manager for multiple safety guards."""
250
251    def __init__(self):
252        """Initialize safety guard manager."""
253        self.guards = []
254
255    def add_guard(self, guard: SafetyGuard) -> None:
256        """Add a safety guard.
257
258        Parameters
259        ----------
260        guard : SafetyGuard
261            Safety guard to add
262        """
263        self.guards.append(guard)
264
265    def check_all(self, state: np.ndarray, step_idx: int, **kwargs) -> bool:
266        """Check all safety guards.
267
268        Parameters
269        ----------
270        state : np.ndarray
271            Current state
272        step_idx : int
273            Current step
274        **kwargs
275            Additional parameters
276
277        Returns
278        -------
279        bool
280            True if all guards pass
281
282        Raises
283        ------
284        SafetyViolationError
285            If any guard fails
286        """
287        for guard in self.guards:
288            if not guard.check(state, step_idx, **kwargs):
289                raise SafetyViolationError(
290                    guard.get_violation_message(),
291                    type(guard).__name__.lower(),
292                    step_idx
293                )
294        return True
295
296    def clear_guards(self) -> None:
297        """Clear all safety guards."""
298        self.guards.clear()
299
300
301def create_default_guards(config: Any) -> SafetyGuardManager:
302    """Create default safety guards from configuration.
303
304    Parameters
305    ----------
306    config : Any
307        Configuration object
308
309    Returns
310    -------
311    SafetyGuardManager
312        Configured safety guard manager
313    """
314    manager = SafetyGuardManager()
315
316    # Always add NaN guard
317    manager.add_guard(NaNGuard())
318
319    # Add other guards based on configuration
320    safety_config = getattr(config, 'simulation', {})
321    safety_settings = getattr(safety_config, 'safety', None)
322
323    if safety_settings:
324        # Energy guard
325        energy_limits = getattr(safety_settings, 'energy_limits', None)
326        if energy_limits and 'max' in energy_limits:
327            manager.add_guard(EnergyGuard(energy_limits['max']))
328
329        # Bounds guard
330        state_bounds = getattr(safety_settings, 'state_bounds', None)
331        if state_bounds:
332            lower = getattr(state_bounds, 'lower', None)
333            upper = getattr(state_bounds, 'upper', None)
334            if lower is not None or upper is not None:
335                manager.add_guard(BoundsGuard(lower, upper))
336
337    return manager

 4    def __init__(self, message: str, violation_type: str, step_idx: Optional[int] = None):
 5        """Initialize safety violation error.
 6
 7        Parameters
 8        ----------
 9        message : str
10            Error message
11        violation_type : str
12            Type of safety violation
13        step_idx : int, optional
14            Simulation step where violation occurred
15        """
16        super().__init__(message)
17        self.violation_type = violation_type
18        self.step_idx = step_idx

Source CodeÂ¶

 1class EnergyGuard(SafetyGuard):
 2    """Guard against excessive system energy."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self, max_energy: float):
 5        """Initialize energy guard.
 6
 7        Parameters
 8        ----------
 9        max_energy : float
10            Maximum allowed total energy
11        """
12        self.max_energy = max_energy
13        self._violation_msg = ""
14
15    def check(self, state: np.ndarray, step_idx: int, **kwargs) -> bool:
16        """Check energy constraint."""
17        total_energy = np.sum(state**2)
18        if total_energy > self.max_energy:
19            self._violation_msg = (
20                f"Energy violation: {total_energy:.6f} > {self.max_energy:.6f}"
21            )
22            return False
23        return True
24
25    def get_violation_message(self) -> str:
26        """Get violation message."""
27        return self._violation_msg

BoundsGuardÂ¶

Inherits from: SafetyGuard

Guard against state bounds violations.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1class BoundsGuard(SafetyGuard):
 2    """Guard against state bounds violations."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self, lower_bounds: Optional[np.ndarray], upper_bounds: Optional[np.ndarray]):
 5        """Initialize bounds guard.
 6
 7        Parameters
 8        ----------
 9        lower_bounds : np.ndarray or None
10            Lower bounds for state variables
11        upper_bounds : np.ndarray or None
12            Upper bounds for state variables
13        """
14        self.lower_bounds = lower_bounds
15        self.upper_bounds = upper_bounds
16        self._violation_msg = ""
17
18    def check(self, state: np.ndarray, step_idx: int, **kwargs) -> bool:
19        """Check bounds constraint."""
20        if self.lower_bounds is not None:
21            if np.any(state < self.lower_bounds):
22                violated_indices = np.where(state < self.lower_bounds)[0]
23                self._violation_msg = f"Lower bounds violated at indices: {violated_indices}"
24                return False
25
26        if self.upper_bounds is not None:
27            if np.any(state > self.upper_bounds):
28                violated_indices = np.where(state > self.upper_bounds)[0]
29                self._violation_msg = f"Upper bounds violated at indices: {violated_indices}"
30                return False
31
32        return True
33
34    def get_violation_message(self) -> str:
35        """Get violation message."""
36        return self._violation_msg

SafetyGuardManagerÂ¶

Manager for multiple safety guards.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1class SafetyGuardManager:
 2    """Manager for multiple safety guards."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self):
 5        """Initialize safety guard manager."""
 6        self.guards = []
 7
 8    def add_guard(self, guard: SafetyGuard) -> None:
 9        """Add a safety guard.
10
11        Parameters
12        ----------
13        guard : SafetyGuard
14            Safety guard to add
15        """
16        self.guards.append(guard)
17
18    def check_all(self, state: np.ndarray, step_idx: int, **kwargs) -> bool:
19        """Check all safety guards.
20
21        Parameters
22        ----------
23        state : np.ndarray
24            Current state
25        step_idx : int
26            Current step
27        **kwargs
28            Additional parameters
29
30        Returns
31        -------
32        bool
33            True if all guards pass
34
35        Raises
36        ------
37        SafetyViolationError
38            If any guard fails
39        """
40        for guard in self.guards:
41            if not guard.check(state, step_idx, **kwargs):
42                raise SafetyViolationError(
43                    guard.get_violation_message(),
44                    type(guard).__name__.lower(),
45                    step_idx
46                )
47        return True
48
49    def clear_guards(self) -> None:
50        """Clear all safety guards."""
51        self.guards.clear()

FunctionsÂ¶

guard_no_nan(state, step_idx)Â¶

Check for NaN/infinite values (legacy interface).

ParametersÂ¶

state : array-like State array step_idx : int Current step index

RaisesÂ¶

SafetyViolationError If NaN/infinite values detected

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def guard_no_nan(state: Any, step_idx: int) -> None:
 2    """Check for NaN/infinite values (legacy interface).
 3
 4    Parameters
 5    ----------
 6    state : array-like
 7        State array
 8    step_idx : int
 9        Current step index
10
11    Raises
12    ------
13    SafetyViolationError
14        If NaN/infinite values detected
15    """
16    x = np.asarray(state)
17    if not np.all(np.isfinite(x)):
18        raise SafetyViolationError(
19            f"NaN detected in state at step <i> (i={step_idx})",
20            "nan_violation",
21            step_idx
22        )

guard_energy(state, limits)Â¶

Check energy constraint (legacy interface).

ParametersÂ¶

state : array-like State array limits : dict or None Energy limits with â€˜maxâ€™ key

RaisesÂ¶

SafetyViolationError If energy constraint violated

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def guard_energy(state: Any, limits: Optional[Dict[str, float]]) -> None:
 2    """Check energy constraint (legacy interface).
 3
 4    Parameters
 5    ----------
 6    state : array-like
 7        State array
 8    limits : dict or None
 9        Energy limits with 'max' key
10
11    Raises
12    ------
13    SafetyViolationError
14        If energy constraint violated
15    """
16    if not limits or "max" not in limits:
17        return
18
19    x = np.asarray(state, dtype=float)
20    total_energy = np.sum(x * x, axis=-1)
21    max_allowed = float(limits["max"])
22
23    if np.any(total_energy > max_allowed):
24        tmax = float(np.max(total_energy))
25        raise SafetyViolationError(
26            f"Energy check failed: total_energy=<val> exceeds <max> (val_max={tmax}, max={max_allowed})",
27            "energy_violation"
28        )

guard_bounds(state, bounds, t)Â¶

Check bounds constraint (legacy interface).

ParametersÂ¶

state : array-like State array bounds : tuple or None (lower, upper) bounds t : float Current time

RaisesÂ¶

SafetyViolationError If bounds violated

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def guard_bounds(state: Any, bounds: Optional[Tuple[Any, Any]], t: float) -> None:
 2    """Check bounds constraint (legacy interface).
 3
 4    Parameters
 5    ----------
 6    state : array-like
 7        State array
 8    bounds : tuple or None
 9        (lower, upper) bounds
10    t : float
11        Current time
12
13    Raises
14    ------
15    SafetyViolationError
16        If bounds violated
17    """
18    if bounds is None:
19        return
20
21    lower, upper = bounds
22    x = np.asarray(state, dtype=float)
23    lo = -np.inf if lower is None else np.asarray(lower, dtype=float)
24    hi = np.inf if upper is None else np.asarray(upper, dtype=float)
25
26    if np.any(x < lo) or np.any(x > hi):
27        raise SafetyViolationError(
28            f"State bounds violated at t=<t> (t={t})",
29            "bounds_violation"
30        )

apply_safety_guards(state, step_idx, config)Â¶

Apply all configured safety guards.

ParametersÂ¶

state : np.ndarray Current state vector step_idx : int Current simulation step config : Any Configuration object with safety settings

RaisesÂ¶

SafetyViolationError If any safety guard is violated

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def apply_safety_guards(state: np.ndarray, step_idx: int, config: Any) -> None:
 2    """Apply all configured safety guards.
 3
 4    Parameters
 5    ----------
 6    state : np.ndarray
 7        Current state vector
 8    step_idx : int
 9        Current simulation step
10    config : Any
11        Configuration object with safety settings
12
13    Raises
14    ------
15    SafetyViolationError
16        If any safety guard is violated
17    """
18    # Apply NaN guard (always active)
19    guard_no_nan(state, step_idx)
20
21    # Apply energy guard if configured
22    safety_config = getattr(config, 'simulation', {})
23    safety_settings = getattr(safety_config, 'safety', None)
24
25    if safety_settings:
26        # Energy limits
27        energy_limits = getattr(safety_settings, 'energy_limits', None)
28        if energy_limits:
29            guard_energy(state, energy_limits)
30
31        # State bounds
32        state_bounds = getattr(safety_settings, 'state_bounds', None)
33        if state_bounds:
34            # Convert to tuple format expected by guard_bounds
35            if hasattr(state_bounds, 'lower') and hasattr(state_bounds, 'upper'):
36                bounds = (state_bounds.lower, state_bounds.upper)
37            else:
38                bounds = state_bounds
39            guard_bounds(state, bounds, step_idx * 0.01)  # Approximate time

create_default_guards(config)Â¶

Create default safety guards from configuration.

ParametersÂ¶

config : Any Configuration object

ReturnsÂ¶

SafetyGuardManager Configured safety guard manager

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def create_default_guards(config: Any) -> SafetyGuardManager:
 2    """Create default safety guards from configuration.
 3
 4    Parameters
 5    ----------
 6    config : Any
 7        Configuration object
 8
 9    Returns
10    -------
11    SafetyGuardManager
12        Configured safety guard manager
13    """
14    manager = SafetyGuardManager()
15
16    # Always add NaN guard
17    manager.add_guard(NaNGuard())
18
19    # Add other guards based on configuration
20    safety_config = getattr(config, 'simulation', {})
21    safety_settings = getattr(safety_config, 'safety', None)
22
23    if safety_settings:
24        # Energy guard
25        energy_limits = getattr(safety_settings, 'energy_limits', None)
26        if energy_limits and 'max' in energy_limits:
27            manager.add_guard(EnergyGuard(energy_limits['max']))
28
29        # Bounds guard
30        state_bounds = getattr(safety_settings, 'state_bounds', None)
31        if state_bounds:
32            lower = getattr(state_bounds, 'lower', None)
33            upper = getattr(state_bounds, 'upper', None)
34            if lower is not None or upper is not None:
35                manager.add_guard(BoundsGuard(lower, upper))
36
37    return manager
